Sure, here are some tips for finding a good couples therapist:

1. Ask for recommendations - Ask friends, family members, or your healthcare provider for recommendations. You can also check online reviews and directories of therapists.

2. Look for a licensed therapist - Verify that the therapist is licensed to practice in your state or country. You can usually check this on their website or by contacting their licensing board.

3. Choose a therapist with experience in couples therapy - Look for therapists who specialize in couples therapy and have experience working with the specific issues you and your partner are facing.

4. Consider the therapist's communication style - Look for a therapist who you feel comfortable communicating with and who provides clear and direct feedback.

5. Check for cultural competence - If you and/or your partner are from a different cultural or religious background, it may be important to find a therapist who has experience working with diverse populations.

Remember, finding the right therapist for you and your partner may take some time and effort, but the benefits of good therapy can be invaluable for improving your relationship.
